name: Palmer Coolum Resort

reviews.text: We spent eight days at this resort recently.The resort is in a lovely location and has always had a very good reputation and at $375 room only a night I had expectations[this was a king junior suite for two].We were told at reception that we had been upgraded. When we arrived at the room it was very very dated with lots of trees around and a childrens playground just outside the unit.After complaining we were changed to one of the few upgraded units on site, there was a charge of $450 a night for this room .Eventually the extra charge was waivered.We are both in our sixties the place was full of families with very young children On many occasions while having breakfast [extra charge] we observed small kids handling food from the buffet.When I mentioned this to a staff member it was not really accepted as a genuine complaint,The food was very expensive and the drinks were overpriced a glass of wine ranged between $12-$16.This place has a lot of potential but at those prices I felt riped off and definitly there was no luxury.When you go to places like that I can fully understand why people go overseas.We would not have chosen this place if we knew there would be so many families with small children.Most of the staff were very pleasant and did theire job well.And as for Clive Palmers dinosaur on the golfing green enough said.I would not recommend this place unless they looked at there prices
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: We only stayed overnight at the Palmer Coolum in a two bedroom woodland villa. Never knew much about this resort but pleasantly surprised. The room was old but large and everything was in good condition. The whole resort is definitely very family orientated - would not go there for a romantic weekend away. For families - fantastic. There was so much on offer - we were there on school holidays so I do not know what it is like other times. Even though the resort was busy - it never felt crowded. The staff were very helpful and polite. I was also surprised that you could directly access the beach from the resort. If you were energetic you could easily ride a bike there or just a short buggy ride. There were many eating options there for families. If you are looking for a family holiday with plenty of things to keep the kids active - definitely consider Palmer Coolum.
reviews.title: Short but good stay

reviews.text: Need to ensure you get an itemised bill and check it. There were unexplained increases in room charges, random mini bar costs and an additional 4000 dollars all taken by the hotel. When raised with them they were extremely unhelpful. It could be a decent destination, definitely not 5 star, if they improved poor food offerings and service. 25 minutes to wait for a wine menu followed by 20 mins to get the bottle. At one point they tried to tell me the steak sandwich I was served was actually the wagyu beef burger with egg and beet root i ordered!!
reviews.title: Very poor, lots of extras added to the bill, poor service

reviews.text: Very expensive for what it is, I am still trying to get the 4000 dollars refunded!!!!
reviews.title: Very, very, very poor

reviews.text: As a visitor to the resort for the past 6 years, i expected the new owner, to have the resort in top shape deliverying top class service. How wrong was i. Under the hyatt umbrella, i was more than happy to pay the price for the service as we felt it was value for money. We stayed between xmas & new year, couldn't wait to leave. Very poor service, over priced for the service provided, the prices for food has gone up by $10 - $20. The shuttle service was poor, we had a 67 year old mum who has had 2 back operations & a 3 year old boy with a disabilty & no shuttle service. Sent letter after 3 days to the gm, but had no reply from him. Indicative of management. From an outsider looking in, it appears the owner has number crunches in charge of the resort, not hospitality people. Understaffed was one of the problems, however, i have not seen it so empty. Staff were lovely, but they can only do as they are told. VERY SAD, WE WILL NOT BE BACK, AFTER 6 YEARS OF VISITING. Perhaps hyatt can get it back at a reduced price......
reviews.title: Upmarket Caravan Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 1 Saturday Night Early Feb 2013.
reviews.title: Perfect Overnight Stay at the Palmer Resort Coolum

reviews.text: Have stayed at this property twice before under the Hyatt Brand (7 years ago and 2 years ago).
reviews.title: Outstanding Resort and a Fabulous Family Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved it then, still love it now. Check in very fast and efficient, very friendly on front desk. Quick walk over to the concierge desk to arrange the ride up to the room, done straight away. Quick tour around the property on the way to the room, very helpful and friendly driver.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY & YOU DON'T HAVE TO GO ANYWHERE
Management don't care, you're just a number... Overpriced, dated, far from everything, boring
reviews.text: Room was a deluxe Junior Suite, very comfortable king bed in what is an oversized room for its price, which had been recently refurbed. Vey Clean and comfortable, nice view of the first tee of the Golf course. Very quiet room, nothing to disturb the peace, and the local kangaroos, lace monitors and scrub turkeys.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did not eat in any of the main restuarants, had a burger from Burger and Beer, which was FANTASTIC!.
reviews.title: I kept asking, is this value for money...?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Going away for the weekend of our wedding anniversary has been a tradition of ours for many years and we have always been happy with our choices. However, Palmer Coolum Resort surpassed anything we have experienced over recent years. From the moment you arrive you are in relaxation mode as the staff are friendly, professional and instantly take care of checking you in and escorting you to your room. As you are shown to your room you are provided with a tour of the resort and its main features. This is a resort in the true sense of the word. We tried a wide variety of the resturants, cafes and bars. All the staff were friendly and the food was supurb. A couples massage in the Spa topped off a great weekend. We stayed in a Junior Delux Suite. The room was very clean and the mini bar well stocked. The room was unusually large and very well designed with a great sense of seclusion, over looking the lake and golf course.
reviews.title: Great, relaxing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We first visited Hyatt Coolum Resort in February 2009 with a 16 month old baby and I was 7 months pregnant. We really enjoyed. After reading a few reviews last week, we ventured back again for our 5th wedding anniversary this past weekend, minus the children. Despite the torrential rain, the resort has largely remained unchanged over the past 3 years. The staff still give the same great service, the food is very good (despite the restaurants changing names), the grounds are quiet, peaceful and lovely. The staff will do anything for you and are very friendly. We listened to live music in the Village Square on saturday arvo drinking a vino and again on Saturday night until about 10pm. Everyone in the square appeared to be having a great time. There are many pictures of the famous owner but they aren't that obvious. he also has his vintage car collection (6 cars in total) which we found really great as we wouldn't see such a private collection normally. The Spa is still fantastic and part of the resort fee. We didn't venue to the beach due to the weather. The rooms are in need of a makeover but they are still neat, tidy, clean and the bathrooms are the best anywhere...so large! Overall, I suspect the resort isn't in the best condition due to the recent weather on the sunshine coast (January 2013) but it is still great. Even Jeff the T-Rex next to the 18th fairway is amusing!
reviews.title: Still the same great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We;ve spent quite a bit of time here over the years - holidays/boys weekends/conferences/small groups - and rated it as excellent when it was a Hyatt Regency resort.
reviews.title: A 5-Star Resort Sliding Down to 3-Star

reviews.text: The resort was bought by a local billionaire early 2012 (approx) who seems to think because he made his fortune in mining industry, he can turn those skills to the hospitality industry and do it better than the Hyatt.
reviews.title: STILL a lovely, gracious, family friendly resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seems he is quite wrong there.
reviews.title: Anniversary get-away

reviews.text: I used to love coming here when it was the Hyatt and regularly had holidays/ conferences here. I am also a fan of eccentric billionaires so was quite excited to come back and see this beautiful place under Mr Palmers leadership. What a massive dissapointment.
reviews.title: It's so so strange!

reviews.text: Clearly the focus has become on the gimics and not on the hotel as it is looking rundown, cheap and deserted. The signs really are awful. The rooms are falling apart at the seams. We haven't been able to have a bath or shower because the water is brown. Got sick of calling reception about it and having to see the engineer 20 times so went for a swim instead. We also had an ant invasion including hundreds of dead ants in the carpet which I rang up to get fixed. We went out and came back a couple of hours later to find all the alive and dead ants where we left them but a can of moretein on the table! Def not 5 star service!!
reviews.title: Quiet break

reviews.text: The staff here are generally lovely but all just seem sad to be wathing this lovely resort curl up and die. it is a massive resort and needs to be busy and pumping and instead it just feels like a ghost town. I got a bike from a lovely man and went with my two year old daughter to the beach a 10minite ride away. It was actually quite scary as we saw no one at 3 pools or at the beach for over 2 hours and we were a long way from our room or reception if anything went wrong. If its isolation you want you got it. We then got a pizza for dinner (really awful) and saw no one again. Followed by a play in The great kids playground (no one) and a swim in the pool this morning (2 people in 2 hours). Burgers for lunch (average) where we were again the only people. In fact I have seen more dinosaurs at this resort than guests.
reviews.title: Empty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is all just so sad as it is a great resort with so much potential. Lower the room rate and food prices, get more staff and fill up the resort every night! It should be a drawcard for families across SE QLD as is such a good set up - I don't think it will ever be 5 star again but it could be a really nice family friendly 4 star and really play on the dinosaur theme- I don't get the mixing of dinosaurs, titanic 2 and old cars. It just all feels like a mess, prehistoric and weird and I am sad to say I won't be back.
reviews.title: Romantic Valentine's Weekend Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Coolum resort was very quiet, food was good in particular the Captains Table, but expensive.
reviews.title: Romantic Getaway

aka: Hyatt Regency Coolum Hotel Coolum Beach
description: At the base of Mount Coolum on Queensland’s Sunshine Coast, Palmer Coolum Resort is one of Australia's finest all encompassing resort destinations. Accommodation at Palmer Coolum Resort is set amongst natural bushland, lakes and gardens. Spacious King Junior Suites are popular with couples, while 2 bedroom Woodland, Golf and Lakefront Suites are ideal for families. The exclusive Ambassador Club offers the ultimate in accommodation on the Sunshine Coast, with luxurious 2 bedroom and 3 bedroom Suites. The Ambassador Club Lounge also offers breakfast daily, pre-dinner drinks and canapes each evening, a private pool and tennis court. Superb leisure facilities at Palmer Coolum Resort include an 18-hole championship golf course, the largest day spa in the southern hemisphere including 18 treatment rooms, tennis centre with 7 floodlit courts, 9 sparkling swimming pools, direct access to a privately patrolled beach, Kids Club for children aged 6 weeks to 10 years, the activities centre with cookie decorating, archery and much more! The championship course is complemented by an extensive range of practice facilities including the Golf Education Centre with PGA Teaching Professionals available for private lessons, a chipping green with an adjoining practice bunker, a practice putting green and floodlit driving range. Dining options are aplenty, from the casual elegance of the Captain's Table to the relaxed atmosphere of the Palmer Grill, or Village Square with its tantalizing variety of food and beverage outlets. Enjoy Modern Australian at Ned Kelly's restaurant, authentic South East Asian cuisine from The smiling duck, or delicious pizzas from the Pizza Pasta.
